ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write policy memos.
how to break down big topics and build an opinion on it, see problems from different perspectives, learnt about different aspects needed to be looked at to analyze such a big question
I developed more nuanced insights on the complex relationship between the US and China.

I learned about the evolution of China' economic relations with the US since its opening up, as well as how trade and economic relations relate to important topics such as Hong Kong, human rights, climate change cooperation, etc. I learned to write better policy memos. I also heard from some amazing, high-ranking guest speakers in the field of US-China relations, and it was great to hear about both their work experience and their thoughts on the future of US-China relations.
Through seminar discussions, I gained an understanding of the U.S.-China competitive economic landscape.
I learned about the overall U.S.-China economic relationship, as well as how to debate and engage with key tensions and synergies of the relationship.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Really enjoyed the class, not too much to add

great readings, interesting topics to be covered

3hrs is a long time to stay focus, would have preferred to meet twice per week or have a short break in between, would have been interesting to have a different format for midterm and final paper

Strengths: Professor Smith is super engaging and brings so much knowledge into the classroom. Listening to him talk is like listening to an informative podcast - he's able to talk about anecdotes from his work experience in China as well as factual knowledge about US-China relations in such an easy-to-understand, fun way. I like that the assignments gave us a lot of freedom to explore topics we're personally interested in. Workload is generally light, but the reading selection was great.
One potential weakness was that I wish there were slightly more feedback regarding the class debates - not necessarily which side won, but which arguments seemed more/less valid, what important caveat we missed while arguing for one side, etc.

The main strength of this course was Professor Smith, who provided great personal insights on the U.S.-China relationship from his own experiences working at the State Department. The two memos and two debates were tasks that are highly applicable to the real world and a great exercise to think critically about the topics.
I loved the seminar style, and the projects and debates supported the content well.
fantastic course, relevant to real world problems taught by practitioner who knows everything about the field

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Professor Smith is very knowledgable and understands the US-China relationship inside and out.

YES! Best course that I took at Yale - great instructor, such an interesting, hot topic, intellectually stimulating discussions with Prof and peers, great readings that prepare for class but also real-life political discussions
Yes! Professor Hanscom is very knowledgeable and hearing his perspective was eye-opening.

Definitely, Professor Smith brings so much knowledge to the classroom, and he talks about US-China relations in such an engaging way. US-China relations is obviously a super important topic in today's world, and this class would give you considerable insight into the history, status quo, and future of this important relationship, while giving you the freedom to dive deeper into topics you're interested in through assignments. You also get to hear from some great guest speakers.
I would recommend this course to anyone looking to gain a deeper understanding of the U.S. China economic landscape, and discuss events from recent history.
Yes!! Professor Smith is incredible and has so many personal insights to share. Additionally, the topic is timely and important.
100000%. one of the best courses Ive ever taken.
